meanings.definition: To make a soft, wet sound.
meanings.sent1: The rain began to plap against the window.
meanings.sent2: I heard the fish plap as they jumped back into the water.
meanings.sent3: The baby giggled as she tried to plap her hands in the bathtub.
meanings.sent4: The leaves plapped against the ground in the gentle breeze.
meanings.sent5: The mud plapped under my feet as I walked through the puddle.

meanings.sent1: The plap of the rain on the roof was soothing.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the plap of the water dripping from the leaky faucet.
meanings.sent3: The plap of the pancake hitting the plate made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The plap of the wet towel hitting the floor echoed in the room.
meanings.sent5: The plap of the frog jumping into the pond was unmistakable.
